conclusion: Analyze the image and use refraction principles to determine which light has the smallest propagation speed.
Image shows a ball with a hollow center and a beam of red, green, and purple light at an incident angle of 45 degrees.
Understand the relationship between angles of incidence and refraction; green light is tangent to the inner wall.
Identify refraction angles: angle of incidence is 45 degrees, refracted angle is the same for all colors.
Refractive index is determined by the ratio of speed of light in vacuum to speed in the material.
Smaller refractive index means smaller speed of light in the material.
Refractive index for red light is greater than green, which is greater than purple.
Speed of light is smallest for purple light due to smallest refractive index.
Final conclusion: C light (purple) has the smallest propagation speed.
